Uses of Package
mansionBandit.gameView

Packages that use mansionBandit.gameView
mansionBandit.ApplicationWindow   
mansionBandit.gameView   
 

Classes in mansionBandit.gameView used by mansionBandit.ApplicationWindow
GamePanel
          This panel is responsible for displaying the game world It takes a Player as an argument, and renders the room that player is in.
 

Classes in mansionBandit.gameView used by mansionBandit.gameView
DrawnObject
          wrapper class to hold a game object to be drawn.
RoomView
          RoomView contains all objects and information required to draw a view of a single room on the screen By default the room will be rendered as if it is directly in front of the viewer, with the viewer standing flat against the back wall.
Surface
          a surface in a room (wall, floor, ceiling) different strategies can be passed in to the surface to determine how it is drawn (eg left wall or back wall) NOTE: Strategy pattern has become somewhat redundant due to strategies no longer being swapped around, which was the initial reason for using the design pattern
SurfaceStrategy
          SurfaceStrategy handles drawing each 'surface' in the game
